org.rsna.ctp.pipeline

Class Pipeline

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • org.rsna.ctp.pipeline.Pipeline
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Pipeline
extends java.lang.Thread
    The class that represents a single pipeline.

      • Pipeline

        public Pipeline(org.w3c.dom.Element pipeline,
        int index)
        A Thread representing a processing pipeline for FileObjects (and subclasses of FileObjects - DicomObjects, XmlObjects, and ZipObjects).
        Parameters:
        pipeline - the XML element from the configuration file specifying the stages in the pipeline.

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Check whether this pipeline is enabled in the configuration.
        Returns:
        true if this pipeline is enabled, false otherwise.

      • allowsAdminBy

        public boolean allowsAdminBy(org.rsna.server.User user)
        Check whether a user has admin privileges for this pipeline. To have admin privileges, the user must either have the global admin role or be named in the admin attribute of the pipeline.
        Returns:
        true if the user has admin privileges for this pipeline, false otherwise.

      • getPipelineIndex

        public int getPipelineIndex()
        Get the index of this Pipeline object. This is used by some servlets to identify the pipeline of a stage
        Returns:
        the index of this Pipeline object.

      • isDown

        public boolean isDown()
        Check whether the pipeline has shut down.
        Returns:
        true if the pipeline has cleanly shut down; false otherwise.

      • getConfigHTML

        public java.lang.String getConfigHTML(org.rsna.server.User user)
        Get HTML text describing the configuration of the pipeline by calling the getConfigHTML methods of each of the pipeline stages in turn. This method is called by the ConfigurationServlet.
        Parameters:
        user - the requesting user (if the user has the admin role, the configuration is displays the values of username and password attributes.
        Returns:
        HTML text describing the configuration of the pipeline.

      • getStatusHTML

        public java.lang.String getStatusHTML()
        Get HTML text describing the status of the pipeline by calling the getStatusHTML methods of each of the pipeline stages in turn. This method is called by the StatusServlet.
        Returns:
        HTML text describing the status of the pipeline.
